1. Installing.title: 1. Install Python
description: Visit the official Python website: Python.org
Download the latest version of Python (preferably the stable version)
Run the installer and follow the instruction

1. Installing.title: 2. Integrated Development Environment (IDE)
description: You can use various tools for Python programming. Some popular choices include: PyCharm, Visual Studio Code

1. Installing.title: 3. Your First Program
description: Open your editor, create new python file and write simple 'Hello World' program

2. Basics.title: 1. Function print()
description: It is used to display the output on the screen
You can use the print() function to display text, numbers, and variables

2. Basics.title: 2. Data Types
description: Int - it is used to store integer values
float - it is used to store decimal values
string - it is used to store text values
boolean - it is used to store True or False values

2. Basics.title: 3. Variables
description: You can print add, subtract, multiply, divide, etc. variables
Your data must be the same type. You cannot add a string to an integer
You can change your data type using the int(), float(), str() functions

2. Basics.title: 4. User Input
description: You are able to dynamically change the value of a variable
You can use the input() function to get user input
Remember that input() function always returns a string

3. Conditional Statements.title: 1. If Statement
description: if - it is used to check if a condition is true. If it is, the code block is executed
else - it is used to execute a block of code if the condition is false
elif - it is used to check multiple conditions. If the previous condition is false, the next condition is checked

3. Conditional Statements.title: 2. Advanced Conditions
description: You can use the and, or, not operators to combine multiple conditions
You can use the in, not in operators to check if a value is in a sequence
code:
if 'a' not in 'alphabet': 
 	 print('a is not in alphabet')

4. Loops.title: 1. For Loop
description: for - it is used to iterate over a sequence (list, tuple, string, etc.)
You can use the break statement to stop the loop before it has finished
You can use the continue statement to stop the current iteration and continue with the next

4. Loops.title: 2. While Loop
description: while - it is used to execute a block of code as long as a condition is true
You can use the break statement to stop the loop before it has looped through all the items
You can use the continue statement to skip the current iteration of the loop and continue with the next

5. Lists.title: 1. Introduction to Lists
description: It is used to store multiple items in a single variable
You can use the append() method to add an item to the end of the list
You can use the insert() method to add an item at a specified index

5. Lists.title: 2. Managing Lists
description: You can use the remove() method to remove an item from the list
You can use the pop() method to remove an item at a specified index

5. Lists.title: 3. More List Operations
description: You can use the del keyword to remove an item at a specified index
You can use the clear() method to empty the list
code:
my_list = ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd'] 
 print(my_list) 
 del my_list[1] 
 print(my_list) 
 my_list.clear() 
 print(my_list)

5. Lists.title: 4. Copying Lists
description: You can use the copy() method to copy the list
You can use the list() method to copy the list

6. Functions.title: 1. Basics of Functions
description: DRY - Don't Repeat Yourself
Functions are used to package code into reusable functions
You can also use them to organize your code
You need to write function name and () to call it

6. Functions.title: 2. Returning Values
description: Function can return some value
You can use it to assign value to variable
code:
def add_function(a, b): 
 	 return a + b 
 result = add_function(2, 3) 
 print(result)

6. Functions.title: 3. Function Parameters
description: Functions can have parameters
You can use them to pass values to functions
